snippet: Stephen Colbert looks to be the front-runner to take over David Letterman’s late-night spot, and that may not be the best news for fans of Mr. Colbert.
abstract: Jason Zinoman Critic's Notebook column notes that Stephen Colbert is the front-runner to replace David Letterman on The Late Show, arguing that outcome could spell disappointment for fans of his nimble satire on The Colbert Report; holds there is not as much room for in-jokes and innovation on network programming with a large national audience.
lead_paragraph: Stephen Colbert looks to be the front-runner to take over David Letterman’s late-night spot, and that may not be the best news for fans of Mr. Colbert.

headline.print_headline: A Big Job Might Ruin a Good Thing
headline.seo: Gauging Stephen Colbert as a ‘Late Show’ Host
headline.main: A Big Job Might Ruin a Good Thing
